meanings.definition: A musical composition for one or more instruments or voices.
meanings.sent1: The concert featured beautiful organums played by the orchestra.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed listening to the organums at the music recital.
meanings.sent3: The organums in the symphony seemed to dance together in harmony.
meanings.sent4: The organums in the song intertwined like a delicate dance.
meanings.sent5: The organums filled the room with a rich and melodious sound.

meanings.definition: A part of an organism that performs a specific function.
meanings.sent1: The heart is a vital organums that pumps blood throughout the body.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how different organums work together in the human body.
meanings.sent3: The organums in the body are like a team, each with its own role to play.
meanings.sent4: The brain can be seen as the organums that controls all other parts of the body.
meanings.sent5: Each organums in the body plays a crucial role in maintaining health.

meanings.definition: A system or structure that performs a specific function within an organization.
meanings.sent1: The new software program acts as an efficient organums for data management.
meanings.sent2: The communication network serves as a vital organums in the company.
meanings.sent3: The organums of the scheduling system made everyone's work easier.

meanings.sent5: The organums of the organization worked seamlessly to achieve their goals.
